qas.question: How far from its studio could the BBC's broadcast originally reach?
In what year were BBC broadcasts seen in the United States?
What company did the U.S. engineers who saw the BBC broadcast work for?
What did the RCA employees use in order to receive the BBC signal?
What was 40 kilometers away from the Alexandra Palace transmitter?
What was picked up in 1940 by engineers at RCA in New York?
What were engineers experimenting with in Alexandra?

context: Initially, <b4_0>the station's range<b4_0/> was officially a <a0_0>40 kilometres<a0_0/> radius of the Alexandra Palace transmitter—in practice, however, <b5_0>transmissions<b5_0/> could be picked up a good deal further away, and on one occasion in <a1_0>1938<a1_0/> were picked up by engineers at <a2_0>RCA<a2_0/> in New York, who were experimenting with <a3_0><b6_0>a British television set<a3_0/>.
